**Second Language Vocabulary Learning 2021 Spring Semester**
------------------------------------------------------------

Instructor – Professor Howard Hao-Jan Chen 陳浩然 Phone: 77491781

誠大樓英語系 八樓 800   Hours– Tuesday and Thursday afternoons or by appointment. Email: hjchenntrnu@gmail.com

**Textbook: The Routledge Handbook of Vocabulary Studies (2019)Edited By** 

**[Stuart Webb](https://www.routledge.com/search?author=Stuart%20Webb)**
------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Week 1. 02-23** 1 Introduction  Stuart Webb

**Week 2. 03-2** meeting 2 The different aspects of vocabulary knowledge Paul Nation; 3 Classifying and identifying formulaic language David Wood

**Week 3. 03-9** meeting 6 Frequency as a guide for vocabulary usefulness: High-, mid- and low-frequency words Laura Vilkaitė-Lozdienė and Norbert Schmitt

7 Academic vocabulary   Averil Coxhead

**Week 4. 03-16** meeting 8 Technical vocabulary Dilin Liu and Lei Lei

9 Factors affecting the learning of single word items   Elke Peters

**Week 5. 03-23** meeting 10 Factors affecting the learning of multiword items

Frank Boers ;  11 Learning single words vs. multiword items   Ana Pellicer-Sánchez

**Week 6 03-30** meeting 12 Processing single- and multi-word items Kathy Conklin; 13 L1 and L2 vocabulary size and growth   Imma Miralpeix

**Week 7. 04-13**    15 Incidental vocabulary learning  Stuart Webb; 16 Intentional L2 vocabulary learning  Seth Lindstromberg

**Week 8. 04-20**  17 Approaches to learning vocabulary inside the classroom Jonathan Newton  19 Corpus-based wordlists in second language vocabulary research, learning, and teaching  Thi Ngoc Yen Dang

**Week 9. 04-27**   21 Resources for learning single-word items; Oliver Ballance and Tom Cobb; 22 Resources for learning multi-word items Fanny Meunier

**Week 10. 05-04** 23 Evaluating exercises for learning vocabulary Batia Laufer

24 Measuring depth of vocabulary knowledge  Akifumi Yanagisawa and Stuart Webb

**Week 11. 05-11**  25 Measuring knowledge of multiword items Henrik Gyllstad

28 Sensitive measures of vocabulary knowledge and processing: Expanding Nation’s framework Aline Godfroid

**Week 12. 05-18**  30 Key issues in teaching single word items  Joe Barcroft

31 Key issues in teaching multiword items  Brent Wolter

**Week 13. 05-25**  32 Single, but not unrelated: Key issues in teaching single word items  Tessa Spätgens and Rob Schoonen; 33 Key issues in researching multiword items Anna Siyanova-Chanturia and Taha Omidian

**Week 14. 06-01** Final presentations

**Week 15. 06-08** Final paper presentations

Grading:

1\. Each person should be responsible for summarizing class readings (plus class discussion). 40%

2.     A final research paper for any topic in vocabulary learning or teaching- 40% (about 8-10 pages) (research topic-due: midterm)

3.     Assignments 10% review of various tools.

4.     Classroom participation/discussion and sharing ideas: Web messages forum participation and sharing information. 10%
